name: Roundwood, hardwood, green, at mill, SE
description:
All weights given on an ovendry basis.
Both logs and bark were transported jointly - however, these were seperated in the model based on mass allocation.  This unit process only accounts for the transport of logs and excludes the transport of bark.
Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has 
undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet 
undergone a formal validation process.
Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.

processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Questionnaires from 12 mills from the 8 states of southeast region.  Hardwood sawmills were members of the Hardwood Manufacturer Association (HMA).
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: SE = Southeast United States.  The 8 states are Arkansas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, Tennessee, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia.

exchanges.description: Based on a weighted average green density of 854 kg/m3

flow.name: Roundwood, hardwood, green, at mill, SE

exchanges.description: Transport of green bark 60.4 km.  85% moisture content, od basis
Weight reported on an ovendry basis.  Moisture content (ovendry basis) = 85%

flow.name: Bark, hardwood, green, at mill, SE

exchanges.description: Oven-dried weight; specific gravity of 0.558 and 85% MC ,od basis

flow.name: CUTOFF Bark, hardwood, at forest road, SE

exchanges.description: Transport of green logs  60.4 km.  85% moisture content, od basis
oven-dried weight. Wood specific gravity of 0.528 and 85% MC dry basis.

flow.name: CUTOFF Roundwood, hardwood, at forest road, SE
